intro: Hypoxis dregei, commonly known as the African buttercup, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae and is characterized by its bright yellow, cup-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and is often found in open woodlands. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and is known for its ornamental value. Hypoxis dregei is also valued in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
